alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Marion, southeastern Chattahoochee, eastern Stewart, Webster and southwestern Sumter Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Jamestown/south Fort Benning to near Troutman, and moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Buena Vista, Preston, Richland, Plains, Weston, Seminole, Kimbrough, Brooklyn, Renfroe, Draneville, Zellobee, Leveretts, Troutman, Church Hill, Centerpoint and Dumas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
